attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my severe discontent with the proposed increase if fees for
USCIS adoption petitions. I think it is unconsciousable to raise fees and make
adoption an even more expensive, difficult process than it already is. I would like to
suggest that the current fees should be held constant instead of raised as other USCIS
fees. Based on the proposed changes, our family will be spending an additional $1000
(possibly $2000, since the paperwork may expire before our adoption is finalized and
we will have to refile) in adoption related expenses--on top of the already high cost of
the adoption process in general. Please consider those of us who are already
stretching ourselves to the limits to bring a child home and make a family. An extra
$1000 to $2000 is a HUGE difference to those of us struggling to make this happen.
Thank you for your consideration. Kyla and Eric Hartunian U.S. Army Ft. Sill,
Oklahoma
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kyla Hartunian
